channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Marissa Calligeros
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Morrison brings forward decision on whether to relax restrictions; AFL hoping for June reboot

item.description: Sydney living with coronavirus, May 1, 2020
item.title: Sydney living with coronavirus, May 1, 2020

item.description: The Chinese tech giant, which owns stakes in video game companies Riot Games and Supercell, had said earlier this year it would focus more on smart retail and payment platforms in the future.
item.title: China's WeChat owner buys $390 million stake in Australia's Afterpay

item.dc:creator: Pallavi Singhal
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Scott Morrison says COVIDSafe downloads, social distancing must continue before wind-back of COVID-19 restrictions, Australian death toll stands at 93

item.description: US regulators have allowed emergency use of an experimental drug that appears to help some coronavirus patients recover faster.
item.title: FDA allows emergency use of drug remdesivir to treat coronavirus

item.dc:creator: Tatyana Leonov
item.description: Grit is not only working hard at something despite setbacks, but loving what you do. It’s a combination of resilience, ambition and self-control.
item.title: Learning to harness your grit during tough times

item.description: "Canadians need more than thoughts and prayers," Prime Minister Justin Trudeau said as he announced that Canada would ban the use and trade of assault-style weapons immediately.
item.title: Canada bans assault-style weapons after mass shooting

item.description: Brazil's national funeral home association has pleaded for an urgent airlift of coffins to the city of Manaus, as the country emerges as Latin America's coronavirus epicentre.
item.title: Coffins stacked in trenches, morgue chaos as coronavirus surges in Brazil

item.dc:creator: Matthew Knott
item.description: Presumptive Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden has gone on the front foot to forcefully deny an allegation of sexual assault by a former staff member.
item.title: Joe Biden denies ex-staffer Tara Reade’s sexual assault claim

item.description: Follow our rolling coverage.
item.title: Tablet interactive: Coronavirus outbreak

item.dc:creator: Adele Ferguson
item.description: Members Equity Bank, which is owned by 26 industry funds, has been plundering without warning customer money linked to home loans.
item.title: 'Despicable ME': The boutique bank raiding accounts linked to home loans

item.dc:creator: Chip Le Grand
item.description: Daniel Andrews has been a strong leader in a crisis. Will he trust Victorians to take things from here?
item.title: Welcome to Victoria, the Doomsday State

item.dc:creator: Nick Toscano
item.description: As big business and the federal government dig in on gas, the world is turning against the fuel and evidence is growing that it is as destructive as coal.
item.title: Falling for an old flame: Can Australia really grow through gas?

item.dc:creator: John Silvester
item.description: For Philip Hocking, his adoptive mother's generosity was never enough. He wanted all her money and to get it he enlisted his son, Brent.
item.title: Murder in the family: Phyllis Hocking and the mysterious broken watch

item.dc:creator: Michael Chammas
item.description: Channel Nine has expressed an interest in taking over the NRL's digital assets in return for a new, extended rights deal until 2025.
item.title: Nine targets NRL's digital arm as part of revised broadcast deal

item.dc:creator: Michael Evans
item.description: NSW residents have begun making the first moves back from the coronavirus lockdown in a bid to deal with mental health now and the economic reality to come.
item.title: Small steps towards the big breakout

item.dc:creator: Chris Barrett
item.description: As cricket cuts costs and tries to explain a cash crisis, the most influential of the state associations has appointed former opener Greg Mail as its new head of cricket.
item.title: NSW bucks trend with key hire as Cricket Australia tightens belt

item.dc:creator: Phil Lutton
item.description: The cycling great has bared her soul in a new book that goes well beyond the velodrome, from the death of her coach to her life as a foster carer and new mum.
item.title: 'He never gave up hope:' Anna Meares on grief, love and new beginnings

item.dc:creator: Natassia Chrysanthos
item.description: Uniting, which operates 56 centres in NSW and the ACT, will stand down 45 staff as it loses $1 million each month under the government's free childcare scheme.
item.title: Uniting to stand down childcare staff while it awaits funding injection

item.dc:creator: Matt Wade
item.description: The coronavirus crisis poses a thorny question: should NSW press on with the current infrastructure pipeline regardless?
item.title: Pandemic re-think: is $40 billion in mega projects best way out of slump?

item.dc:creator: Deborah Snow
item.description: After 100 days spearheading the state's bushfire recovery effort, Mick Willing returns to policing and hands over to a familiar face in a new role.
item.title: The fighting force behind the bushfire recovery effort

item.dc:creator: Karl Quinn
item.description: In 1980, Jack Thompson and Breaker Morant headed to the world's most famous film festival and helped put the Australian film industry firmly on the map.
item.title: 'Flagship' Jack Thompson still sailing 40 years after watershed win in Cannes

item.dc:creator: Adele Ferguson
item.description: A leaked letter shows the ACCC is aiming to file a case against the scandal-plagued Retail Food Group by June.
item.title: Donut King owner RFG faces legal action by June

item.dc:creator: George Megalogenis
item.description: While Scott Morrison would have preferred to celebrate our British heritage, and China tried to school us in superpower diplomacy, a third country, India, snuck up on us.
item.title: Over-Cooked: a new twist in the national tale

item.dc:creator: The Herald's View
item.description: With unemployment forecast to reach 10 per cent, the state must not cut back on spending and investment.
item.title: NSW must put the economy before the budget

item.description: Free daily horoscope for each star sign from renowned Astrologer Hedy Damari. Forecasts for the day ahead in life, love and career.
item.title: Your Daily Horoscope for Saturday, May 2

item.dc:creator: Michael Lallo
item.description: 'Everybody deserves to evolve,' says the popular new MasterChef judge.
item.title: 'No point in sanitising your past': Melissa Leong praised by viewers

item.dc:creator: Alexandra Smith
item.description: The NSW Treasurer said a five-point strategy for NSW would focus on improved productivity, tax reforms, deregulation, digitisation, trade and investment.
item.title: Perrottet's recovery plan to axe 'inefficient' stamp duty, payroll taxes

item.dc:creator: Geoffrey Robertson
item.description: Australia's push for an international inquiry into the origins of COVID-19 is reasonable. Here's how to proceed without being seen as Trump’s patsy.
item.title: UN fact-finders can establish COVID truth, untainted by China or the US

item.dc:creator: Ross Gittins
item.description: Uniquely, this recession has happened because of a knowing act of government policy. As we’re about to discover, it’s a huge price to pay.
item.title: After the anti-social lockdown comes the anti-jobs recession

item.dc:creator: Clancy Yeates
item.description: Big four bank shares have historically been prized for their fat dividends, but the payouts are now under severe pressure.
item.title: Don't bank on it, payout shock as dividends hit the wall

item.dc:creator: Tom Switzer
item.description: Higher levels of government intervention will only lead to sclerosis, the raising of taxes, the suppression of enterprise and unsustainable debt.
item.title: Capitalism is not finished - and we'll need it to escape this abyss

item.dc:creator: Julia Baird
item.description: During this pandemic female leaders are suddenly being touted as the most effective and competent leaders when it comes to keeping it under control.
item.title: Boris can bring home a baby but for true cool in a crisis you want a woman

item.description: The NRL will have a bright future when it has zero tolerance towards players who show contempt for authority and seem to think they are above the law.
item.title: Halfback or halfwit? Answer’s Cleary-cut

item.dc:creator: Nicole Lindsay
item.description: Nan Xin has splashed out $8 million on a Hawthorn development site near Auburn station.
item.title: Cashed-up Nan Xin heads to Hawthorn for next project

item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Farrelly
item.description: People struggling to work from home in shared living spaces are discovering a kink in the logic of the open plan.
item.title: Open-plan living has quite possibly made your lockdown life hell

item.dc:creator: Carolyn Cummins
item.description: The creation of Sydney's city-based multi-billion dollar technology precinct has moved a step closer.
item.title: Dexus, Frasers move closer to $2.5b Central tech hub

item.dc:creator: Carolyn Cummins
item.description: The coronavirus is hitting the country's biggest apartment developer, Mirvac, which revealed a slump in settlements for its residential business in the March quarter.
item.title: Mirvac reports fall in residential sales

item.dc:creator: Simon Johanson
item.description: Developer Digital Harbour is pressing ahead with a $500 million commercial office in Melbourne’s Docklands.
item.title: Twin tower plan for Docklands harbour site

item.description: The new chancellery at Monash University’s Clayton campus has a distinctly mid-20th century feel.
item.title: Monash's inspired mid-century, but contemporary new chancellery

item.dc:creator: Matt O'Sullivan
item.description: Stitching together a patchwork of small parks, cycle and pedestrian paths is considered one way to improving public spaces.
item.title: Rush to parks, cycleways during shutdown reveals Sydney's great divide

item.description: The joy of work and engagement are more likely to come from us becoming our own pop artists and elevating our mundane tasks.
item.title: Even the mundane can be interesting – if you look closely

item.dc:creator: Helen Pitt
item.description: Head On Photo Festival begins online on May 2.
item.title: On My Mind: Head On Festival photographer Toby Burrows

item.dc:creator: Charlotte Grieve
item.description: Not that long ago Sam Scilia was being hailed as an investment visionary. Now he and the fund he leads are facing a barrage of criticism.
item.title: Hostplus CIO Sam Sicilia's super high risk strategy faces its toughest test

item.dc:creator: Robert Moran
item.description: Classic films from pop culture's most maligned decade.
item.title: Top five forgotten '80s movies you can stream now

item.dc:creator: Jennifer Duke
item.description: The mayors of some of Australia's best-known tourist towns fear many local businesses will close for good without more government help as they bear the brunt of restrictions on "non-essential" services to stop the spread of coronavirus.
item.title: 'Ground to a halt': Worst-hit tourist towns brace for double-digit downturns

item.description: If lockdown has done anything, it has made us stop and consider what we really need to get by.
item.title: Was this lockdown the reboot into a life really worth living?

item.dc:creator: Aimie Rigas
item.description: Peter Hartcher's opinion piece on China prompted the most opinions this week.
item.title: Readers trade views on China relations

item.dc:creator: Danny Katz
item.description: Only this wasn’t - it was last week.
item.title: It was a beautiful autumn day in 1978...

item.dc:creator: Anna Prytz
item.description: Independent schools are not lining up to receive an advance on federal funding.
item.title: Independent schools reject federal funding, wait for state health advice
